page.title: 13 SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: Statutory services at{SHEEN CENTRE} include clinics, computerised library, citizens' advice with legal aid, and clubrooms with canteen, crafts hall, bar and resident warden, for over-60s. Grounds are an oasis amidst traffic and shoppers, with rear parking for volunteer drivers. Closely linked are voluntary groups for care (FISH) and housing; ABBEYFIELD administers the new Oxford House with housekeeper and 6 residents in single self-furnished rooms, and RICHMOND CHURCHES HOUSING TRUST built Diana House sheltered accommodation for severely handicapped, with warden, in Walnut Tree Close (flats for old/ young families on shared mortgages). Both societies buy, adapt and rent old properties. CoE churchgoers' survey found 35% renting, 20% lone pensioners. Further schemes underway.
